results.title: Harry Potter and the chamber of secrets
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, David Heyman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The second instalment in the Harry Potter series returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, in what is arguably a stronger film than its predecessor, despite belief that the novel on which the film is based, is the weakest in the series. An enchanting musical score and solid animation are supported by strong performances of young actors Daniel Radcliff, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint, who reprise their roles as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Between dealing with cryptic house-elves, flying cars, Quidditch, and attempting to keep one step ahead of the nasty Slytherins, who has time to study? However, when muggle-born students are being attacked, it is once again up to Harry and his friends to save the day. The all-star British cast includes Jason Isaacs as the malicious Lucius Malfoy and Kenneth Branagh as pompous professor Gilderoy Lockhart who join Richard Harris, in one of his final roles, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis. Based on the novel by J.K. Rowling.

results.title: Harry Butler's Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Harry Butler takes us on a journey through Tasmania’s unique parks and open areas, highlighting the love of getting away from it all.

results.title: Harry and Walter go to New York
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Don Devlin, Harry Gittes, Tony Bill, Columbia and Safecracker Productions
results.brief_description: This comedy caper film set in the 1890’s (the period meticulously re-created by art director Harry Horner) features James Caan and Elliot Gould as a vaudeville song and dance team who, after being thrown into jail on a petty theft charge make the acquaintance of a big time crook (Michael Caine). Together they devise a plot to execute a major bank robbery - with disastrous results. Cast also includes Diane Keaton.

images.caption: Harry and Walter go to New York (Mark Rydell) still

results.title: Harry and the Lady Next Door
results.brief_description: The lady next door sings in a high voice that could shatter glass or hurt a dog’s ears. And, she rehearses constantly. Harry tries just about everything to drown out the lady’s singing, but even a mooing herd of cattle and a loud marching band cannot put a stop to the lady’s relentless rhapsodies. An action-packed sequel to “Harry The Dirty Dog.”

results.title: Harry's half crown
results.creator_credit: Derek Logan, Jim Moody and Ushaw Moor Secondary Modern School
results.brief_description: Filmed during the period, September 1961 to March 1962 over 20 afternoons. This is a film by the students of Form 3A at Ushaw Moor Secondary School, County Durham, whereby the work included film teaching, scripting, location shooting, acting, music teaching, sound recording and film and sound editing. Scripted after their own stories, this amusing film is about a lower middle-class adolescent boy given the chore of buying groceries for his mother but spends the time mucking about with his friends and terrorising the neighbours. During this little outing, he spots a half crown coin lying in the gutter, which he splurges with his friends on sweets - but where has the grocery money gone?

results.title: Harrison's Yukon
results.creator_credit: Shelah Reljic, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ted Harrison settled in the Yukon in 1967. He has been living and painting there ever since. The Yukon proved to be a challenge Harrison had to come to terms with. The result is an artistic style characterized by bold, brilliant colors. Harrison’s perception of Canada’s North contradicts its traditionally bleak portrayal. His brightly colored houses and figures suggest a toyland dominated by mountains, snow and sky. The film is a fine introduction to the artist, his work and the geography that has so profoundly influenced him. (Award: Yorkton)

results.title: Harriet the spy
results.creator_credit: Bronwen Hughes, Mary Kay Powell and Rastar Films
results.brief_description: 11 year old sixth grader Harriet M. Welsch (Michelle Trachtenberg) has an alter ego, she is a spy and aspiring writer who records all the goings on during her designated spy routes as well as her observations about her classmates: best friends Sport (Gregory Smith) and Janie (Vanessa Lee Chester), linked by a concealed tattoo and mutual dislike of class brat Marion Hawthorn. Isolated from her argumentative and absent parents, creative and observant Harriet finds solace in her writing and love with her nanny Ole Golly (Rosie O’Donnell). Harriet’s world is turned upside down when Golly leaves her family’s employment and her notebook is found and read, her private feelings about her friends exposed. Banned from writing, Harriet embarks on a revenge campaign against those who have bullied her since finding out what she really thinks of them, but revenge does not assuage her pain and she has to consider another way to gain forgiveness. At times an agonising coming of age film, the film does have a happy ending with a place for individuality and friendships are restored. Includes a cameo by Eartha Kitt as one of Harriet’s snooping accomplishments. Based on the successful novel by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: Harold Lloyd's world of comedy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lloyd and Harold Lloyd Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of the best short Harold Lloyd sequences. Films excerpted include: ‘Safety last’, ‘Hot water’, ‘Why worry’, ‘Feet first’, ‘Girl shy’, ‘Movie crazy’, ‘Professor beware’.
